page.title: 05Kingswood Civic Centre.
page.content: Built in 1983, covering a 3.8 acre site, the Civic Centre houses the offices of{local government,}looking after a population of 87,244.There are 6 departments:administration, finance, environmental health, planning (land development), housing and technical (recreation, roads, refuse).Employed within are 200 manual and 200 administrative staff. In charge are 47 elected{Councillors,}who meet every 6 weeks in the Council Chamber.The running cost, plus wages, for 1984/85 is approx.Â£300,000.This is paid for from the{Rates,}a tax paid by every householder.The Centre often hires out its rooms for poetry recitals, guest speakers, weddings and exhibitions (in May 1985 a display of local school art work and in June, photos, maps and objects of a Victorian Kingswood.)
